intro: Pentacalia iguaquensis, commonly known as the Iguáquez pentacalia, is a flowering plant native to the Andean region of South America. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its showy, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant typically grows in rocky or mountainous habitats, thriving in cool, humid environments. Its leaves are usually narrow and lance-shaped, with a slightly hairy texture. Pentacalia iguaquensis is relatively rare and is of interest to botanists due to its unique ecological adaptations.
